sentence.Network_en: The air was fresh, courtesy of three holes in the roof.
sentence.Network_cn: 房顶有3个洞，所以空气很清新。

jx.jx_en_mean: as a favour rather than by right

lj.lj_ly: he was not at the conference only by courtesy.
lj.lj_ls: 他出于好意才没有参加会议。

lj.lj_ly: photograph courtesy of the Evening Star.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French cortesie, from corteis (see courteous)

entry.def: Courtesy is politeness, respect, and consideration for others.

example.ex: ...a gentleman who behaves with the utmost courtesy towards ladies...
example.tran: 对女士极有风度的绅士

example.ex: He did not even have the courtesy to reply to my fax.
example.tran: 他连回复我传真的这点儿礼貌都没有。

entry.def: If you refer to the courtesy of doing something, you are referring to a polite action.

example.ex: By extending the courtesy of a phone call to my clients, I was building a personal relationship with them...
example.tran: 通过礼貌性地给客户打电话，我开始和他们建立起私交。

example.ex: At least if they're arguing, they're doing you the courtesy of being interested.
example.tran: 如果他们在争论，那至少是他们出于礼貌向你表示感兴趣。

entry.def: Courtesies are polite, conventional things that people say in formal situations.

example.ex: Hugh and John were exchanging faintly barbed courtesies.
example.tran: 休和约翰正说着带有相互挤兑意味的客气话。

entry.def: Courtesy is used to describe services that are provided free of charge by an organization to its customers, or to the general public.

example.ex: A courtesy shuttle bus operates between the hotel and the town.
example.tran: 有免费班车往返于酒店和市区。

entry.def: A courtesy call or a courtesy visit is a formal visit that you pay someone as a way of showing them politeness or respect.

example.ex: The President paid a courtesy call on Emperor Akihito.
example.tran: 总统对明仁天皇进行了礼节性的拜访。

entry.tran: (无法律实效的或非正式的)尊称
entry.def: A courtesy title is a title that someone is allowed to use, although it has no legal or official status.

example.ex: Both were accorded the courtesy title of Lady...
My title, by courtesy only, is the Honourable Amalia Lovell.
example.tran: 人们称我为，当然只是出于礼貌，尊敬的阿马利娅·洛弗尔夫人。

entry.tran: (用来表示感谢)承蒙…的好意，蒙…提供
entry.def: If something is provided courtesy of someone or by courtesy of someone, they provide it. You often use this expression in order to thank them.

example.ex: The waitress brings over some congratulatory glasses of champagne, courtesy of the restaurant...
example.tran: 女侍者端来几杯饭店赠送的用来庆祝的香槟。

example.ex: Illustrations by courtesy of the National Gallery.
example.tran: 图片由国家美术馆提供。

entry.def: If you say that one thing happens courtesy of another or by courtesy of another, you mean that the second thing causes or is responsible for the first thing.

example.ex: The air was fresh, courtesy of three holes in the roof...
example.tran: 房顶有3个洞，所以空气很清新。

example.ex: As millions will have seen, by courtesy of the slow motion re-runs, the referee made a mistake.
example.tran: 慢动作重放后，数百万人都可以看到裁判错判了。

means.word_mean: 1. a courteous or respectful or considerate act
2. a courteous or respectful or considerate remark

sentences.en: They didn't even have the courtesy to apologize.
sentences.cn: 他们也不道个歉, 真没有礼貌。

sentences.en: Do me the courtesy of listening to what I have to say.
Through the courtesy of your Commercial Counsellor, we get to know your company name and address.
sentences.cn: 承蒙贵国商务参赞告知，我得悉贵司公司名称和地址。

jushi.english: He didn't even have the courtesy to apologize.
jushi.chinese: 他也不道个歉,真没有礼貌。

jushi.english: Do me the courtesy of listening to what I have to say.
